newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Brasmotor begun as hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Brasmotor begun as hold.

text.p: -- ING Barings said it has begun coverage of Brazilian appliance holding company Brasmotor S.A. with a hold recommendation.
-- The brokerage said in a statement that Brasmotor, which owns leading Brazilian white goods maker Multibras, is benefitting from a four-year boom in appliance sales.
-- "While profitability should remain high, we expect growth to slow and increased competition from new entrants to force prices and margins down from current levels," the statement said.
-- ING estimates 1996 earnings for the firm of $47.74 per share and frecasts 1997 and 1998 earnings of $39.55 and $35.35 per share respectively.

-- Despite attractive price-earnings ratio forecasts of 6.9 for 1997 and 7.7 for 1998, ING has not started the firm with a by rating because of expectations of slower growth, rising competition and lower earnings from current levels, it said.
-- Brasmotor's preferred was up two reais at 280 reais at 1151 local/0851 est on the Sao Paulo bolsa. Its voting common was untraded after closing at 250 reais Jan 20.
